questions.question: Base-rate neglect involves:
questions.explanation: Base-rate neglect occurs when people ignore general probabilities in favor of specific information.

questions.question: P(A|B) means:
questions.explanation: P(A|B) represents conditional probability - the probability of A occurring given that B has occurred.

questions.question: Posterior probability considers:
questions.explanation: Posterior probability combines prior beliefs with new evidence using Bayesian reasoning.

questions.question: Why do rare events distort intuitive probability judgments?
acceptable_answers: they are memorable and seem more likely
availability heuristic makes them stand out
